title: Pure maps are strict monomorphisms
abstract:
We prove that $i)$ if $\mathcal{A}$ is $\lambda $-accessible and it is
axiomatizable in (finitary) coherent logic then $\lambda $-pure maps are strict
monomorphisms and $ii)$ if there is a proper class of strongly compact
cardinals and $\mathcal{A}$ is $\lambda $-accessible then for some $\mu
\vartriangleright \lambda $ every $\mu $-pure map is a strict monomorphism.
